Returned if the calling user does not have permission to view the
content templates.

get.description:
Returns a content template. This includes information about template, 
like the name, the space or blueprint that the template is in, the body 
of the template, and more.

**[Permissions](https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/_AozKw) required**: 
'Admin' permission for the space to view space templates and 'Confluence 
Administrator' global permission to view global templates.

parameters.name: contentTemplateId
parameters.description: The ID of the content template to be returned.

200.description: Returned if the requested template is returned.

delete.description:
Deletes a template. This results in different actions depending on the 
type of template:

- If the template is a content template, it is deleted.
- If the template is a modified space-level blueprint template, it reverts 
to the template inherited from the global-level blueprint template.
- If the template is a modified global-level blueprint template, it reverts

get.description:
Returns a user. This includes information about the user, like the
display name, userKey, account ID, profile picture, and more.

The `username`, `key`, or `accountId` parameter must be specified, in 
order to identify the user.

**[Permissions](https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/_AozKw) required**: 
Permission to access the Confluence site ('Can use' global permission).

parameters.name: key
parameters.description:
This parameter has been deprecated due to privacy changes. Use `accountId` instead. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

The userKey of the user to be returned. Required, unless the 
`username` or `accountId` is specified. The `key` uniquely identifies 
a user in a Confluence instance and does not change.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description:
This parameter has been deprecated due to privacy changes. Use `accountId` instead. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

The username of the user to be returned. Required, unless the `key` 
or `accountId` is specified. The `username` uniquely identifies a 
user in a Confluence instance but can change if the user is renamed.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The account ID of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products.
For example, `384093:32b4d9w0-f6a5-3535-11a3-9c8c88d10192`. Required, unless `username` or `userKey` is specified.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the user to
expand.

  - `operations` returns the operations that the user is allowed to do.
  - `details.personal` returns the 'Personal' details in the user's profile, like the 'Email' and 'Phone'.
  Note that these fields have been deprecated due to privacy changes. See the
  [migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
  for details.
  - `details.business` returns the 'Company' details in the user's profile, like the 'Position' and 'Department'.
  Note that these fields have been deprecated due to privacy changes. See the
  [migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
  for details.
  - personalSpace returns the user's personal space, if it exists.

200.description: Returned if the requested user is returned.

401.description:
Returned if the authentication credentials are incorrect or missing 
from the request.

403.description: Returned if the calling user does not have permission to view users.

404.description:
Returned if a user with the given username, userkey, or accountId
does not exist.

get.description:
Returns whether a user is watching a piece of content. Choose the user by 
doing one of the following:

- Specify a user via a query parameter: Use the `username`, `key`, or `accountId` to identify the user.
Note that `username` and `key` have been deprecated in favor of `accountId`. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.
- Do not specify a user: The currently logged-in user will be used.

**[Permissions](https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/_AozKw) required**: 
'Confluence Administrator' global permission if specifying a user, otherwise 
permission to access the Confluence site ('Can use' global permission).

parameters.name: contentId
parameters.description:
The ID of the content to be queried for whether the specified user is 
watching it.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description:
This parameter has been deprecated due to privacy changes. Use `accountId` instead. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

The `key` of the user to be queried for whether they are watching the 
content. Required, unless the `username` or `accountId` is specified.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description:
The `username` of the user to be queried for whether they are watching 
the content. Only one of `username`, `key`, `accountId` can be used to 
identify the user in the request.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The `accountId` of the user to be queried for whether they are watching the content. The accountId uniquely
identifies the user across all Atlassian products. For example, `384093:32b4d9w0-f6a5-3535-11a3-9c8c88d10192`.
Required, unless `username` or `userKey` is specified.

200.description: Returned if the requested watch status is returned.

403.description:
Returned if;

- The calling user does not have permission to view the
content.
- A user is specified via a query parameter and the calling user is 
not a Confluence administrator.
- No content exists for the specified `contentId`.

404.description: Returned if no `contentId` is specified.

403.description: Returned if the user does not have permission to create content at destination

id.description: The ID of the attachment to be updated.

title.description: The updated name of the attachment.

creationDate.description: The creation date-time of the audit record, as a timestamp.

remoteAddress.description: The IP address of the computer where the event was initiated from.

creationDate.description:
The creation date-time of the audit record, as a timestamp. This is converted 
to a date-time display in the Confluence UI. If the `creationDate` is not 
specified, then it will be set to the timestamp for the current date-time.

summary.description:
The summary of the event, which is displayed in the 'Change' column on 
the audit log in the Confluence UI.

description.description:
A long description of the event, which is displayed in the 'Description' 
field on the audit log in the Confluence UI.

category.description:
The category of the event, which is displayed in the 'Event type' column 
on the audit log in the Confluence UI.

sysAdmin.description: Indicates whether the event was actioned by a system administrator.

changedValues.description: The values that were changed in the event.

associatedObjects.description:
Objects that were associated with the event. For example, if the event 
was a space permission change then the associated object would be the 
space.

Content.title: Content
Content.description: Base object for all content types.

container.description:
Container for content. This can be either a space (containing a page or blogpost) 
or a page/blog post (containing an attachment or comment)

title.description:
The title of the content. If you don't want to change the title, 
set this to the current title of the draft.

type.description: The type of content. Set this to `page`.

ancestors.description:
The new ancestor (i.e. parent page) for the content. If you have 
specified an ancestor, you must also specify a `space` property 
in the request body for the space that the ancestor is in.

Note, if you specify more than one ancestor, the last ID in the array 
will be selected as the parent page for the content.

ContentBodyCreate.title: ContentBodyCreate
ContentBodyCreate.description: This object is used when creating or updating content.

value.description: The body of the content in the relevant format.

ContentChildType.title: ContentChildType
ContentChildType.description:
Shows whether a piece of content has attachments, comments, or child pages.
Note, this doesn't actually contain the child objects.

id.description: The ID of the draft content. Required when publishing a draft.

ancestors.description:
The parent content of the new content. Only one parent content 
`id` can be specified.

ContentMetadata.title: ContentMetadata
ContentMetadata.description: Metadata object for page, blogpost, comment content

value.description: The value of the content property. This can be empty or a complex object.

key.description: The key of the new property.

value.description:
The value of the property. This can be empty or a complex object. 
For example,
```
"value": {
  "example1": "value",
  "example2": true,
  "example3": 123
}
```

The value of the property. This can be empty or a complex object. 
For example,
```
"value": {
  "example1": "value",
  "example2": true,
  "example3": 123
}
```

restrictionsHash.description:
This property is used by the UI to figure out whether a set of restrictions 
has changed.

ContentTemplateCreate.title: ContentTemplateCreate
ContentTemplateCreate.description: This object is used to create content templates.

name.description: The name of the new template.

templateType.description: The type of the new template. Set to `page`.

description.description: A description of the new template.

ContentTemplateUpdate.title: ContentTemplateUpdate
ContentTemplateUpdate.description: This object is used to update content templates.

templateId.description: The ID of the template being updated.

name.description:
The name of the template. Set to the current `name` if this field is 
not being updated.

templateType.description: The type of the template. Set to `page`.

title.description: The updated title of the content. If you are not changing this field, set this to the current `title`.

ancestors.description: The new parent for the content. Only one parent content 'id' can be specified.

GroupArrayWithLinks.title: GroupArrayWithLinks
GroupArrayWithLinks.description: Same as GroupArray but with `_links` property.

Icon.title: Icon
Icon.description: This object represents an icon. If used as a profilePicture, this may be returned as null, depending on the user's privacy setting.

name.description: The name of the label, which will be shown in the UI.

LookAndFeelUpdated.title: LookAndFeelUpdated
LookAndFeelUpdated.description: Look and feel settings returned after an update.

LookAndFeelType.title: LookAndFeelType
LookAndFeelType.description: The object for choosing the look and feel settings for the site or a space.

LongTaskStatusWithLinks.title: LongTaskStatusWithLinks
LongTaskStatusWithLinks.description: Same as LongTaskStatus but with `_links` property.

OperationCheckResult.title: OperationCheckResult
OperationCheckResult.description: An operation and the target entity that it applies to, e.g. create page.

number.description: The number of units for the retention period.

SpaceCreate.title: SpaceCreate
SpaceCreate.description: This is the request object used when creating a new space.

key.description:
The key for the new space. Format: See [Space
keys](https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/lqNMMQ).

name.description: The name of the new space.

permissions.description:
The permissions for the new space. If no permissions are provided, the 
[Confluence default space permissions](https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/UAgzKw#CreateaSpace-Spacepermissions)
are applied. Note, for security reasons, permissions cannot be changed
via the API after the space has been created, and must be changed via
the user interface instead.

SpaceDescriptionCreate.title: SpaceDescriptionCreate
SpaceDescriptionCreate.description:
The description of the new/updated space. Note, only the 'plain' representation 
can be used for the description when creating or updating a space.

SpacePermission.title: SpacePermission
SpacePermission.description:
This object represents the permissions for a space. Permissions consist of 
at least one operation object with an accompanying subjects object.

The following combinations of `operation` and `targetType` values are 
valid for the `operation` object:

  - 'create': 'page', 'blogpost', 'comment', 'attachment'
  - 'read': 'space'
  - 'delete': 'page', 'blogpost', 'comment', 'attachment'
  - 'export': 'space'
  - 'administer': 'space'

anonymousAccess.description: Grant anonymous users permission to use the operation.

unlicensedAccess.description:
Grants access to unlicensed users from JIRA Service Desk when used
with the 'read space' operation.

SpacePrivateCreate.title: SpacePrivateCreate
SpacePrivateCreate.description: This is the request object used when creating a new private space.

key.description:
The key for the new space. Format: See [Space
keys](https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/lqNMMQ).

name.description: The name of the new space.

key.description: The key of the new property.

value.description:
The value of the property. This can be empty or a complex object. 
For example,
```
"value": {
  "example1": "value",
  "example2": true,
  "example3": 123
}
```

The value of the property. This can be empty or a complex object. 
For example,
```
"value": {
  "example1": "value",
  "example2": true,
  "example3": 123
}
```

routeOverrideEnabled.description:
Defines whether an override for the space home should be used. This is
used in conjunction with a space theme provided by an app. For
example, if this property is set to true, a theme can display a page
other than the space homepage when users visit the root URL for a
space. This property allows apps to provide content-only theming
without overriding the space home.

Defines whether an override for the space home should be used. This is
used in conjunction with a space theme provided by an app. For
example, if this property is set to true, a theme can display a page
other than the space homepage when users visit the root URL for a
space. This property allows apps to provide content-only theming
without overriding the space home.

ThemeNoLinks.title: ThemeNoLinks
ThemeNoLinks.description: Theme object without links. Used in ThemeArray.

themeKey.description: The key of the theme to be set as the space theme.

username.description:
This property has been deprecated in favor of `accountId`, due to privacy changes. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

The username of the user. For example, _admin_.

userKey.description:
This property has been deprecated in favor of `accountId`, due to privacy changes. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

The user key of the user.

accountId.description:
The account ID of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products.
For example, `384093:32b4d9w0-f6a5-3535-11a3-9c8c88d10192`.

displayName.description: The display name of the user. Depending on the users privacy setting, this may be returned as null.

UserArrayWithLinks.title: UserArrayWithLinks
UserArrayWithLinks.description: Same as UserArray but with `_links` property.

WatchUser.title: WatchUser
WatchUser.description:
This essentially the same as the `User` object, but no `_links` property and 
no `_expandable` property (therefore, different required fields).

username.description:
This property has been deprecated in favor of `accountId`. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

The username of the user. For example, _admin_.

userKey.description:
This property has been deprecated in favor of `accountId`. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

The user key of the user.

accountId.description:
The account ID of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products.
For example, `384093:32b4d9w0-f6a5-3535-11a3-9c8c88d10192`.

id.description: The content ID of the ancestor.

Author1.title: Author1
Author1.description:
The user that actioned the event. If `author` is not specified, then all 
`author` properties will be set to null/empty, except for `type` which 
will be set to 'user'.

displayName.description: The name that is displayed on the audit log in the Confluence UI.

username.description: The username of the user that actioned the event.

userKey.description: The userKey of the user that actioned the event.

Body1.title: Body1
Body1.description:
The body of the new content. Does not apply to attachments. 
Only one body format should be specified as the property for 
this object, e.g. `storage`.

Note, `editor2` format is used by Atlassian only. `anonymous_export_view` is 
the same as 'export_view' format but only content viewable by an anonymous 
user is included.

Body2.title: Body2
Body2.description:
The updated body of the content. Does not apply to attachments.
If you are not sure how to generate these formats, you can create a page in the 
Confluence application, retrieve the content using [Get content](#api-content-get), 
and expand the desired content format, e.g. `expand=body.storage`.

position.description:
This property has been deprecated due to privacy changes. There is no replacement. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

department.description:
This property has been deprecated due to privacy changes. There is no replacement. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

location.description:
This property has been deprecated due to privacy changes. There is no replacement. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

Container.title: Container
Container.description: The new content to attach the attachment to.

type.description:
The content type. You can only attach attachments to content 
of type: `page`, `blogpost`.

Group2.title: Group2
Group2.description: A group that the restriction will be applied to.

Homepage.title: Homepage
Homepage.description: The page to set as the homepage of the space.

mediaType.description: The media type of the attachment, e.g. 'img/jpg'.

Operation2.title: Operation2
Operation2.description: The restriction operation applied to content.

versionNumber.description: The version number to be restored.

phone.description:
This property has been deprecated due to privacy changes. There is no replacement. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

im.description:
This property has been deprecated due to privacy changes. There is no replacement. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

website.description:
This property has been deprecated due to privacy changes. There is no replacement. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

email.description:
This property has been deprecated due to privacy changes. There is no replacement. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

Representation2.title: Representation2
Representation2.description:
The content format type. Set the value of this property to 
the name of the format being used, e.g. 'storage'.

Restrictions2.title: Restrictions2
Restrictions2.description:
The users/groups that the restrictions will be applied to. At least one of 
`user` or `group` must be specified for this object.

user.description:
The users that the restrictions will be applied to. This array must 
have at least one item, otherwise it should be omitted.

group.description:
The groups that the restrictions will be applied to. This array must 
have at least one item, otherwise it should be omitted.

Selected1.title: Selected1
Selected1.description:
The look and feel scheme. If you set this to `global`, you must specify 
the current global look and feel settings as a `global` object in this 
request. Similarly, if you set this to `custom`, you must specify the 
current custom look and feel settings as a `custom` object in this request.

Space2.title: Space2
Space2.description: The space that the content is being created in.

Space3.title: Space3
Space3.description:
The key for the space of the new template. Only applies to space templates. 
If the spaceKey is not specified, the template will be created as a global 
template.

Space4.title: Space4
Space4.description:
The key for the space of the template. Required if the template is a 
space template. Set this to the current `space.key`.

Status.title: Status
Status.description: The status of the content. Set this to `current` or omit it altogether.

Status1.title: Status1
Status1.description: The status of the new content.

Status2.title: Status2
Status2.description:
The updated status of the content. Note, if you change the status of a page from 
'current' to 'draft' and it has an existing draft, the existing draft will be deleted 
in favor of the updated page.

Subjects.title: Subjects
Subjects.description: The users and/or groups that the permission applies to.

TargetType.title: TargetType
TargetType.description: The space or content type that the operation applies to.

Type1.title: Type1
Type1.description: The type of the new content. Custom content types defined by apps are also supported.

Type3.title: Type3
Type3.description: The type of content. Set this to the current type of the content.

Units.title: Units
Units.description: The unit of time that the retention period is measured in.

User2.title: User2
User2.description:
A user that the restriction will be applied to. Either the `username` 
or the `userKey` must be specified to identify the user.

username.description:
This property has been deprecated due to privacy changes. Use `accountId` instead. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

The username of the user. For example, _admin_. Required, unless `accountId` or `userKey` is specified.

userKey.description:
This property has been deprecated due to privacy changes. Use `accountId` instead. See the
[migration guide](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/)
for details.

The user key of the user. Required, unless `accountId` or `username` is specified.

accountId.description:
The account ID of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products.
For example, `384093:32b4d9w0-f6a5-3535-11a3-9c8c88d10192`. Required, unless `username` or `userKey` is specified.

Version2.title: Version2
Version2.description: The version for the new content.

number.description: The version number. Set this to `1`.

Version4.title: Version4
Version4.description: The version number of the property.

number.description:
The new version for the updated content property. Set this to the
current version number incremented by one. To get the current
version number, use 'Get content property' and retrieve
`version.number`.

minorEdit.description:
If `minorEdit` is set to 'true', no notification email or activity
stream will be generated for the change.

Version5.title: Version5
Version5.description:
The new version for the updated content. Set this to the current version number incremented by one, unless you are changing the status to 'draft' which must have a version number of 1. 

To get the current version number, use [Get content by ID](#api-content-id-get) and retrieve `version.number`.

Version7.title: Version7
Version7.description: The version number of the property.

number.description:
The new version for the updated space property. Set this to the
current version number incremented by one. To get the current
version number, use 'Get space property' and retrieve
`version.number`.

minorEdit.description:
If `minorEdit` is set to 'true', no notification email or activity
stream will be generated for the change.

Version8.title: Version8
Version8.description:
The attachment version. Set this to the current version number of the 
attachment. Note, the version number only needs to be incremented when 
updating the actual attachment, not its properties.

externalDocs.description: The online and complete version of the Confluence Cloud REST API docs.
